Detailed Description

The section has a list of all the exported API which the applications need to invoke in order to use the driver.

Function Documentation

int32_t QSPIFlash_blockErase ( QSPIFlash_Handle  QSPIFlashHandle,
uint32_t  addr 
)

Description
This function erases a 64K block.

Parameters
[in]QSPIFlashHandleHanlde of the QSPI flash driver
[in]addrAddress of the 64KB block to be erased
Return values
=0Successful block erase
<0Error code when block erase failed
int32_t QSPIFlash_chipErase ( QSPIFlash_Handle  QSPIFlashHandle)

Description
This function erases the complete flash.

Parameters
[in]QSPIFlashHandleHanlde of the QSPI flash driver
Return values
=0Successful chip erase
<0Error code when chip erase failed

This function clears the block protection bits

Parameters
[in]QSPIFlashHandleHanlde of the QSPI flash driver
Return values
None
int32_t QSPIFlash_close ( QSPIFlash_Handle  QSPIFlashHandle)

Description
This function closes QSPI Flash driver and resources used by the driver

Parameters
[in]QSPIFlashHandleHandle to the QSPI flash driver
Return values
=0Successful close
<0Error code when close with failures
int32_t QSPIFlash_configMmapRead ( QSPIFlash_Handle  QSPIFlashHandle,
FLASH_READ_MODE  mode,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
This function sets up configuration for memory-map read

Parameters
[in]QSPIFlashHandleHanlde of the QSPI flash driver
[in]modeMode of the memory mapped read
[in]errCodeError code populated in the API
Return values
=0Successful read
<0Error code when read failed

void QSPIFlash_dualRead ( QSPIFlash_Handle  QSPIFlashHandle,
uint32_t  srcAddr,
uint32_t  dataLen,
uint16_t *  userDataBuf 
)

Description
This function does dual read in config mode

Parameters
[in]QSPIFlashHandleHanlde of the QSPI flash driver
[in]srcAddrFlash address, half word aligned
[in]dataLenData length in half words
[in]userDataBufPointer to the data to be written, half word aligned
Return values
None

int32_t QSPIFlash_mmapRead ( QSPIFlash_Handle  QSPIFlashHandle,
const uint32_t *  memAddr,
uint32_t  dataLen,
uint32_t *  userDataBuf 
)

Description
This function reads from QSPI flash in memory mapped mode

Parameters
[in]QSPIFlashHandleHanlde of the QSPI flash driver
[in]memAddrFlash memory mapped address
[in]dataLenLength of data in double words
[in]userDataBufPointer to the data buffer to save flash data
Return values
=0Successful read
<0Error code when read failed
int32_t QSPIFlash_mmapWrite ( QSPIFlash_Handle  QSPIFlashHandle,
const uint32_t *  memAddr,
uint32_t  dataLen,
uint32_t *  srcDataAddr 
)

Description
This function writes to Flash in memory mapped mode

Parameters
[in]QSPIFlashHandleHanlde of the QSPI flash driver
[in]memAddrmemory mapped flash address
[in]dataLenData length in double words
[in]srcDataAddrData buffer Pointer to copy data from
Return values
=0Successful write
<0Error code when write failed
QSPIFlash_Handle QSPIFlash_open ( QSPI_Handle  QSPIHandle,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
This function opens QSPI Flash driver, can get flash device infomation

Parameters
[in]QSPIHandleHandle to the QSPI driver
[in]errCodeError code to be populated by the driver in case of error
Return values
QSPIFlashhandle Success
NULLpointer. Failure

Description
This function prepares the serial flash for quad interface operation

Parameters
[in]QSPIFlashHandleHanlde of the QSPI flash driver
Return values
None
void QSPIFlash_quadRead ( QSPIFlash_Handle  QSPIFlashHandle,
uint32_t  srcAddr,
uint32_t  dataLen,
uint32_t *  userDataBuf 
)

Description
This function does quad read in config mode

Parameters
[in]QSPIFlashHandleHanlde of the QSPI flash driver
[in]srcAddrFlash address, word aligned
[in]dataLenData length in words
[in]userDataBufWord aligned data buffer pointer to save data from flash
Return values
=0Successful read

Return values

void QSPIFlash_singleRead ( QSPIFlash_Handle  QSPIFlashHandle,
uint32_t  memAddr,
uint32_t  dataLen,
uint8_t *  userDataBuf 
)

Description
This function does single read in config mode

Parameters
[in]QSPIFlashHandleHandle of the QSPI flash driver
[in]memAddrFlash address.
[in]dataLendata length in bytes
[in]userDataBufPointer to the data buffer to be written.
Return values
=0Successful read
void QSPIFlash_singleWrite ( QSPIFlash_Handle  QSPIFlashHandle,
uint32_t  memAddr,
uint32_t  dataLen,
uint8_t *  srcDataAddr 
)

Description
This function does a single byte Flash write in config mode

Parameters
[in]QSPIFlashHandleHanlde of the QSPI flash driver
[in]memAddrFlash memory mapped address
[in]dataLenLength of data in bytes
[in]srcDataAddrData buffer pointer to copy data from
Return values
None
int32_t QSPIFlash_sysDmaRead ( QSPIFlash_Handle  QSPIFlashHandle,
DMA_Handle  dmaHandle,
uint32_t  dmaChan,
uint32_t  srcAddr,
uint32_t  dstAddr,
uint32_t  dataLen 
)

Description
This function sets up DMA read

Parameters
[in]QSPIFlashHandleHandle to the QSPI flash driver object
[in]dmaHandleHandle to DMA driver
[in]dmaChanDMA channel number used for the DMA read
[in]srcAddrFlash source address of the read operation, address should be double word aligned
[in]dstAddrDestination address of the read operation , address should be double word aligned
[in]dataLenData length of the DMA read in double words
Return values
=0Data is read successfully
<0Error code for DMA read operation
int32_t QSPIFlash_sysDmaWrite ( QSPIFlash_Handle  QSPIFlashHandle,
DMA_Handle  dmaHandle,
uint32_t  dmaChan,
uint32_t  srcAddr,
uint32_t  dstAddr,
uint32_t  dataLen 
)

Description
This function sets up DMA write, and transfer data from user buffer to flash

Parameters
[in]QSPIFlashHandleHandle to the QSPI flash driver object
[in]dmaHandleHandle to DMA driver
[in]dmaChanDMA channel number used for the DMA read
[in]srcAddrUser buffer address of the write operation, address should be double word aligned
[in]dstAddrFlash address of the write operation , address should be double word aligned
[in]dataLenData length of the DMA read in double words
Return values
=0Data is written successfully
<0Error code for DMA write operation
void QSPIFlash_writeDisable ( QSPIFlash_Handle  QSPIFlashHandle)

Description
This function disables write to flash.

Parameters
[in]QSPIFlashHandleHanlde of the QSPI flash driver
Return values
None
void QSPIFlash_writeEnable ( QSPIFlash_Handle  QSPIFlashHandle)

Description
This function enables write to flash. It is needed before erase and page program operation.

Parameters
[in]QSPIFlashHandleHanlde of the QSPI flash driver
Return values
None
